Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
Promethean - the name of a Secret tech.

This world was once a hub of the Phoenix division's Promethean research, their vaults still lying dormant on the surface.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Gold and Silver [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are replaced with [abilityblue]Phoenix Vaults[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Phoenix division - the founders of the Promethean secret tech.

The Cataclysm was not kind to this world, leaving not an ember of civilization.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][population/][hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]Settlements[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
The Cataclysm - the apocalyptic end of the Star Union that saw worlds cut off from one another.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.

This world has suffered a viral bombing in the past that has left its mark to this day.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred][DamageBio/]Biochemical [hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink][/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.

The post-Cataclysm conflicts were particularly intense on this world, leaving many traces of discharged weaponry on its surface long after the conflicts fizzled out.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred][hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink][/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred] on this world.[/bullet][/bulletList]
The Cataclysm - the apocalyptic end of the Star Union that saw worlds cut off from one another.

This world was once a breadbasket for Star Union worlds around the sector, this specialized nature still evidenced by the world's remaining installations.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][supply/]Food [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Food [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][research/]Research [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Research [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]rare[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][production/]Production [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Production [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world was in the process of being stripmined by Redcore when the cataclysm hit. Vast quarries and mineshafts still perforate the surface of this world.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][production/]Production [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Production [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][research/]Research [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Research [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]rare[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][supply/]Food [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Food [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Redcore - a corporation of miners from which the Dvar originated.

The Void leaks into reality on this world, spawning plentiful sources of Cosmite, but also bringing with it volatile Void Storms.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue][hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink][/abilityblue] and pickups are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][DamagePhysical/][abilityred]Void Storm [hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink][/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Cosmite - a strange material seemingly originating from the void, of immense value. Used by the player for advanced units and upgrades.

The Cosmite on this world has been exhausted, and mere scraps remain for those that brave its surface.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue][hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink][/abilityblue] [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityblue][hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] Pickups[/abilityblue] are [abilityred]rare[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Cosmite - a strange material seemingly originating from the void, of immense value. Used by the player for advanced units and upgrades.

This world hosted a vast network of transmission towers, providing information at the masses' fingertips, carefully curated by CORE.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][influence/]Transmission Towers are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][influence/]Holopad Pickups are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world was once a hub for Star Union scholars, providing research facilities and academies for a wide variety of applications.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][research/]Research [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Research [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][production/]Production [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Production [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]rare[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet] [energy/]Energy Nodes and Bronze Energy [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world generated power at a massive scale, and though the purpose of this vast power network is unknown, it will no doubt prove vital to exploit.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][energy/]Energy Nodes and Bronze Energy [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][production/]Production [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Production [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are [abilityred]rare[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet] [research/]Research [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Nodes[/hyperlink] and Bronze Research [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink]are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Those beaked villains got here first.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Penguin Hives[/abilityred] are [abilityred]present[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

These vile hives of scum and villany are a rare but ominous sight - it is here that the nefarious flightless avians plan their manipulations of the universe.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.

This world houses vast deposits of Quartzite, guarded by its violent offspring.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Psionica[/abilityred] and [abilityred]Quartzite[/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Quartzite - a wildlife species of mineral creatures.

This world has an exceptionally high water level, leaving few landmasses viable for settlement.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Landmasses are [abilityred]minimal[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]The world is divided into [abilityblue]Continents[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world is a hotbed of geothermal activity: water is scarce, and where other worlds would have vast oceans, here there is only lava.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Geothermal Hazards[/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]This world consists of a single [abilityblue]Pangaea[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet]Oceans and coasts are [abilityred]replaced[/abilityred] with [abilityred]Lava[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]Arctic climates are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Badlands[/abilityred] climates are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world has been shattered by the cataclysmic activation of a Promethean doomsday device, leaving its landmass split by volatile oceans of lava.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Geothermal Hazards[/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]This world consists of several [abilityblue]Continents[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet]Oceans and coasts are [abilityred]replaced[/abilityred] with [abilityred]Lava[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]Arctic climates are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Badlands[/abilityred] climates are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][energy/]Teleporters connect all landmasses and are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Promethean - Secret technology based around purification by fire.

This world has suffered an anomalous fate, seemingly frozen in the process of being swallowed by the Void. What landmass remains may still prove a worthy prize for those who brave its surface, however.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]This world consists of several [abilityblue]Continents[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet]Oceans and coasts are [abilityred]replaced[/abilityred] with untraversable [abilityred]Void[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][energy/]Teleporters connect all landmasses and are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Void - refers to an alternate dimension of nothingness, not to be confused with The Abyss

Vile spawn of the Alpha strain infest this world, collecting the DNA of anything foolish enough to wander into its clutches.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Xenoplague Nests[/abilityred] are [abilityred]present[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Xenoplague - a secret technology based around the 'alpha strain', a mutating genome.

The Spacers are broadcasting on open channels some sort of 'XP race'. It seems they are having a competition for who can gain the most 'XP'.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Spacer[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Spacers[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Spacers[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Spacer[/abilityred] units gain [abilityblue]Experience[/abilityblue] three times as fast.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Spacers - survivors of the Cataclysm obsessed with virtual escapism.

A Paragon Warlord has gotten their hands on an Imperial Crown. This artifact has given them unparalleled control over the remaining Paragon, spurring them into violent conflict with any threats to their rule.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Paragon[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Paragon[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Paragon[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Paragon[/abilityred] units gain the [abilityblue]Overcharger Augment[/abilityblue] ability.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Paragon - remnants of Star Union nobility and military.

A First Seed of the Growth forms the heart of a sprawling Growth Garden on this world, their roots spread wide, aggressively rebuffing any colonization efforts.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Growth[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Growth[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Growth[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Growth[/abilityred] units gain [abilityblue]Forest Camouflage[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Growth - A race of sentient plantlife.

The Autonom on this world sustain a particularly powerful network, increasing their effectiveness and aggression in equal measure.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Autonom[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Autonom[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Autonom[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Autonom[/abilityred] Golem and Justicar units gain the [abilityblue]Initialize Connections[/abilityblue] ability.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Autonom - former robot servants of the Star Union, now turned into a 'sentient' collective.

Shoals of Psi-Fish have converged on this world to claim prey, and they will not accept any interruptions.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Psi-Fish[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Psi-Fish[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Psi-Fish[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Psi-fish - A race of psionic jellyfish

This world has a particularly terrifying reputation amongst colonists and they refuse to brave its surface.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Colonizers[/abilityblue] are [abilityred]forbidden[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
PLACEHOLDER - DO NOT TRANSLATE Void - refers to an alternate dimension of nothingness, not to be confused with The Abyss

This planet hosts a powerful Mycelian infestation. At this size, they spread their spores liberally and are to be considered extremely dangerous.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Mycelian[/abilityred] spawners are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Mycelian[/abilityred] spawners spawn more powerful [abilityred]armies[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Mycelian[/abilityred] spawners act as [abilityred]Spore Cloud Hazards[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Mycelians - a wildlife group of creatures, fungus overgrown machinery.

A RPR detachment was seemingly dispatched to this world long ago. Their quarry is likely long gone, but these ruthless machines still remain.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]RPR Towers[/abilityred] are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]RPR Towers[/abilityred] spawn more powerful [abilityred]armies[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]RPR Towers[/abilityred] inflict [abilityred]Targeted[/abilityred] to Biological, Cyborg and Heritor units in the sector.[/bullet][/bulletList]
RPR - or 'Reapers', a wildlife group of robots that seek to wipe out all traces of the Heritors.

This world has a particularly thriving population of Hopperhounds, their hives perforating the planet and dotting the surface, housing a massive population.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Hopperhound[/abilityred] spawners are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Hopperhound[/abilityred] spawners spawn more powerful [abilityred]armies[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Hopperhounds - wildlife creatures akin to giant grasshoppers.

This world yields particularly potent Psionic crystals, and the Psionica seem to be drawn to them.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Psionica[/abilityred] spawners are [abilityred]common[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Psionica[/abilityred] spawners inflict [abilityred]Psycho-Active Crystal[/abilityred] to non-Mindless or Mineral units in the sector.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Psionica[/abilityred] spawners spawn more powerful [abilityred]armies[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Psionic - Psychic powers Psionica - Species of mineral creatures that store and use Psionic energy.
This unit is affected by the Psycho-active Crystals and suffers {moralepenalty}

This world is home to several holy sites, and even those not of the Celestian faith feel a strange, unnatural connection to the imposing landmarks. Perhaps these places are more than mere temples...[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Gold and Silver [abilityblue]Landmarks[/abilityblue] are replaced with [abilityblue]Celestian Archives[/abilityblue].[/bullet][bullet][abilityblue]Celestian Archives[/abilityblue] grant an additional {bonusincome}[/bullet][bullet]Capturing a [abilityblue]Celestian Archive[/abilityblue] grants every other Empire [abilityred]Casus Belli[/abilityred] against that Empire.[/bullet][/bulletList]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{FoodFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{FoodSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{HappinessFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{HappinessSlot/}[/bullet][bullet]{Bonusincome}[/bullet][br/][br/]Capturing this sector grants every other Empire [abilityred]Casus Belli[/abilityred] against that Empire.[/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000330]Starlight Observatory[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

Apostates dominate much of this world, sending forth armies to subjugate the weak from their Dark Towers.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Gold and Silver [abilityblue]Landmarks[/abilityblue] are replaced with [abilityred]Dark Towers[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Dark Towers[/abilityred] spawn aggressive Apostate armies until cleared.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Apostates - a rebel faction that mirrors the Oathbound by embracing chaos, 'black knights'

This world has caught the eye of the Voidbringers, and those seeking to claim it should prepare for their arrival.[bulletList][bullet]The [abilityred]Voidbringers[/abilityred] will invade.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Voidbringer - Outsider unknowable aliens that seemingly seek to dominate and consume all.

A.I.V.A. has detected the trace of a Grail on this planet. Claiming this artifact will grant us immense power.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]A [abilityblue]Grail[/abilityblue] configuration is present.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
A.I.V.A. - the assistant AI that gives the player their tutorial. Grail - a mysterious device that grants great power to the one that claims it.
The Paragon on this world have preserved their position of power from before the Cataclysm. They use elite soldiers and act hostile to any renegades questioning their imperial mandate.

This world has a storied past, featuring a wealth of anomalies to investigate and uncover.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Anomalous Sites[/abilityblue] are [abilityblue]common[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Anomalies - refers to the Survey Sites of DLC03

This world's native factions are highly adaptive, improving and strengthening their armies rapidly in the presence of a foreign threat.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Wildlife Threat level is set to [abilityred]Extreme[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletlist]

This world was claimed by the Voidbringers in the past. For some unknown reason, they have yet to destroy it, instead continuing to infest its surface.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Spawners are replaced with [abilityred]Voidbringer Shards[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet]World Threat is set to [abilityred]Hardcore[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Voidbringer - Outsider unknowable aliens that seemingly seek to dominate and consume all.

A host of Heritor constructs call this world home. Time has been fickle for these Forgotten, filling them with both newfound strength and insanity in equal measure.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Forgotten[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Forgotten[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Forgotten[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Forgotten[/abilityred] units start combat with {EssenceChargeBonus} [abilityblue]Essence[/abilityblue] charges.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Heritors - an ancient secret tech focused around extracting and storing lifeforce. Creators of the Forgotten. Forgotten - Ancient Heritor constructs that have decayed and gone mad.

An ancient Therian ritual, a yearly gathering of various clans, is under way on this world. They will not take kindly to any who disrupt the convention ritual.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Therian[/abilityred] owned sectors are [abilityred]Abundant[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Therians[/abilityred] make more [abilityred]Demands[/abilityred].[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Therians[/abilityred] start at [abilityred]War[/abilityred] with you.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Therian[/abilityred] units gain {Moralebonus}[happiness/].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Therians - a faction of animalistically mutated pirates with cult-like tendencies.

A large Kir'Ko swarm has made this planet its home and seems unwilling to share.[bulletList][bullet]There are 2 [abilityred]Warmonger[/abilityred] Kir'Ko that are allied to each other.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Kir'ko - A race of former bug-like creatures that lost their hive mind. Swarm - usually how Kir'ko refer to their civilizations

Two major Syndicate houses have formed an alliance to lay claim to this world in spite of the claims of numerous smaller houses.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There are 2 Syndicate houses that are allied to each other on this world.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Syndicate - a faction of cunning slave traders divided among houses.

Two Dvar Consortia have laid claim to this world and have brought significant resources to bear to enforce it. A confrontation between them seems inevitable.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There are 2 Dvar consortia present on this world.[/bullet][bullet]These Dvar have each brought [abilityred]additional forces[/abilityred] to this world.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]War[/abilityred] between them seems inevitable.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Dvar - A faction of hyper-capitalist miners Consortia - plural of Consortium, the term by which Dvar subfactions are referred.
An alliance of devout Celestians has come to this world for an unknown purpose.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There is an Alliance of 3 Celestian empires present on this world.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Khansu - controversial emperor whom infamously burned himself and his homeworld in a ritual suicide.

A cult of the Burning Emperor has designated this world to burn out all traces of CORE's influence.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There is an Alliance of 3 Promethean empires present on this world.[/bullet][bullet]This Alliance is pursuing a [abilityred]Doomsday victory[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]
Burning Emperor - nickname of Emperor Khansu
ELOP - stands for Egalitarian League Of Planets, an in universe faction.
This world has been freshly colonized by the Egalitarian League of Planets.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There is an Alliance of 4 empires present on this world.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Egalitarian League Of Planets, an in universe faction.

The Assembly have marked this world for Reassembly and will accept no interference.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There is an Alliance of 3 Assembly empires present on this world.[/bullet][bullet]These Assembly will inevitably go to [abilityred]War[/abilityred] against each other Empire.[/bullet][/bulletList]

A Shakarn Infiltrator has two other factions under the thrall of its manipulations, creating an odd alliance that could prove quite problematic.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]There is an Alliance of 1 Shakarn and 2 other empires present on this world.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Shakarn - a faction of lizard conquerors Infiltrator in this context is literal and does NOT refer to the unit.

This world's atmosphere makes visibility tough, letting armies escape detection with ease.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Player-owned units gain [abilityblue]Universal Camouflage[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

The surface offers many sources for sustenance and spare parts, lowering the upkeep cost of deployed armies significantly.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All unit upkeep is [abilityblue]reduced by {UpkeepDiscount}[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This planet still features an intact global imaging satellite array, letting new arrivals easily map the surface geography.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]On arrival, the map is fully [abilityblue]Explored[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world features precious little resources to maintain large armies, focusing on quality over quantity is paramount.[bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Tier I and II[/abilityblue] unit upkeep is [abilityred]increased by {UpkeepPen}[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

The horizon is close and ill-trusted, visibility of any that brave its surface will be significantly reduced.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Units suffer from [abilityred]Poor Visibility[/abilityred].[/bullet]

The atmosphere of this world is constantly in chaotic motion, making flight difficult.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Flying[/abilityred] units suffer from [abilityred]Turbulence[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world features strange and mutated fauna, making the creatures more resilient than usual.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Wildlife [abilityblue]Animal[/abilityblue] units gain {Hpbonus}[hp/], {armorbonus}[Armor/] and [abilityblue]Mutant[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world lies at a particularly unstable part of the Nexus Network, causing it to be on the receiving end of an excessive amount of cosmic anomalies.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Cosmic Events[/abilityblue] occur directly after one another.[/bullet][/bulletList]
Nexus Network - the system of stabilized 'wormholes' through which travel between Star Union planets was conducted.

This world lays barren and wasted, the Union having long since extracted most of the value from this place.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Non-[abilityblue]Coastal[/abilityblue] sectors without [abilityblue]Rivers[/abilityblue] are [abilityred]Barren[/abilityred], producing {Incomereduction} fewer resources.[/bullet][/bulletList]
The Union - short for Star Union

This world's infertile soil is ill-suited for food production.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][supply/]Food Nodes and Landmarks are [abilityred]absent[/abilityred].[/bullet][bullet][supply/]Food cost for acquiring new Colonists is [abilityred]Increased[/abilityred] by {Costincrease}.[/bullet][/bulletList]

The Cataclysm must have been particularly rough on this world, leading its survivors to be hardy and aggressive.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][abilityblue]Settlements[/abilityblue] cannot be bought with influence.[/bullet][/bulletList]
The Cataclysm - the apocalyptic end of the Star Union that saw worlds cut off from one another.

The atmosphere of this world absorbs electrical energy like a sponge, siphoning energy from everything within at all times.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Unit and building [energy/]Energy Upkeep is [abilityred]Increased[/abilityred] by {UpkeepIncrease}.[/bullet][/bulletList]

The lower than average gravitational field of this world allows for significantly faster movement across its surface.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All units gain [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world's communication networks still buzz with signals, repeating ancient calls and data requests constantly, a perfect cover for covert activity.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][opcovert/][abilityblue]Covert Operations[/abilityblue] are [abilityblue]Never Detected[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This planet's CORE surveillance network is damaged, yet highly active, spewing information into the aether for anyone with a functioning receiver to pick up. There will be no secrets here.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][opcovert/][abilityblue]Covert Operations[/abilityblue] are always [abilityred]Detected[/abilityred] on failure.[/bullet][bullet][abilityblue]Covert Operations[/abilityblue] cost {CostReduction} less.[/bullet][/bulletList]
CORE - an ancient AI that ruled alongside the Star Union's Emperor

This world's native factions have developed a unique aptitude for stealth, hiding all over the planet's surface to ambush potential prey.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Neutral and NPC Faction owned units gain [abilityred]Universal Camouflage[/abilityred].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world still features an intact broadcasting network, a system easily exploited to support a fresh Empire.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Players gain {Doctrineslotbonus} [doctrine/][abilityblue]Doctrine Slots[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world has an extremely unstable surface, offering precious little building space and forcing colonies to stay small.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Colonies [abilityred]cannot[/abilityred] grow beyond {PopLimit} [population/]colonists.[/bullet][/bulletList]

A vast comms network still covers this world, and can be swiftly exploited to aid Strategic Operations.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]All Players gain {OperationStrengthbonus} [operationstrength/][abilityblue]Operation Strength[/abilityblue].[/bullet][/bulletList]

Massive stockpiles of military equipment and munitions remain on this world. One could easily exploit these to significantly discount their Tactical Operations.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][optactical/][abilityblue]Tactical Operations[/abilityblue] do not cost any [energy/]Energy.[/bullet][/bulletList]

This world features a great many military purpose satellites that can be repurposed with ease for use in Tactical Operations.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet][optactical/][abilityblue]Tactical Operations[/abilityblue] do not cost any [castingtactical/]Operation Points.[/bullet][/bulletList]

The waters in this world are extremely rich in minerals and nutreants, providing a boost to aquatic endeavors.[br/][br/][bulletList][bullet]Income from River features and Aquatic sectors is increased by {aquaticBonus}.[/bullet][bullet]Map type is Continents.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
